name: Swap Nodes in Pairs

similar_questions.title: Swapping Nodes in a Linked List

title: Swap Nodes in Pairs
content:
Given a linked list, swap every two adjacent nodes and return its head. You must solve the problem without modifying the values in the list's nodes (i.e., only nodes themselves may be changed.)

 

Example 1:

Input: head = [1,2,3,4]

Output: [2,1,4,3]

Explanation:

Example 2:

Input: head = []

Output: []

Example 3:

Input: head = [1]

Output: [1]

Example 4:

Input: head = [1,2,3]

Output: [2,1,3]

 

Constraints:

  • The number of nodes in the list is in the range [0, 100].
  • 0 <= Node.val <= 100

discussion_posts.name: bharathgowda29
discussion_posts.content: ffs stop bragging "its easy it should be marked easy". yeah def it is easy for you and me, but its def not easy for the ones who are just starting, they will lose their motivation by looking at your comments.

discussion_posts.name: karthiko
discussion_posts.content: Does anyone here also thinks this should be marked Easy (and not Medium)?

discussion_posts.name: charonme
discussion_posts.content: haha I crashed the solution checker by creating a loop in the linked list

discussion_posts.name: psionl0
discussion_posts.content: This problem is a lot easier to code if you attach a dummy node to the front of the list.

discussion_posts.name: JunnQN
discussion_posts.content: With linked list problems, it is often helpful to draw diagrams to make problem-solving easier.

discussion_posts.name: jwonz
discussion_posts.content: One of the top solutions modifies the values in the nodes... Tsk tsk.

discussion_posts.name: the_abhayy
discussion_posts.content: for the One\'s who are saying that it is easy please do a hands on  reversing the links instead of swapping values :)

discussion_posts.name: skadam183
discussion_posts.content: I am javascript guy. Simple looking problem at first turned out very tough. I have checked others solution but  most of them are swapping values or using separate list which is not correct solution as per question even if platform accepted it as correct one.

discussion_posts.name: Leelour
discussion_posts.content: Is there any grantee that there will always be even number of nodes?

discussion_posts.name: zawarvyankatesh132
discussion_posts.content: Solve this like reverse LL in K groups question, simply consider k as 2; done same code easy peasy
